Summary Viraj is a Senior Engineering Manager/Principal Engineer/Tech Lead for the iSearch (Intent Search) team at Yahoo! Search. During his time at Yahoo!, Viraj has worked on/built/launched several industry leading products including Yahoo! Knowledge Graph(Search Entity Graph), Quick Answers on Search Results Page, search clients (toolbars), email and Social networks (Yahoo! Mail/Imap) , high performance web destinations (Yahoo.com). 
 
Innovation areas include algorithms for inserting dynamic content in email protocols, search monetization, web browser manipulation and biometric security (cancelable biometrics). Filed 6 patents in the above areas. 
 
•	12+ experience in C/C++/Java. 
•	12+ years of experience in building scalable client-server architectures.  
• Experience developing with Hbase, Hadoop, Pig Latin, apache, experience with Ajax, JavaScript, html/css, perl on FreeBSD and Windows platforms. 
•	5+ years of experience in developing Firefox and IE clients with a user base of 200 million. 
•	Solid understanding of the business and customer fundamentals for a client/server web product 
•	Internationalization experience for web based products. 
•	Experience in working in a team and communicating with and leading large discussion groups. 
•	Self Starter with proven analytical, research skills. 
 
Have applied engineering and business acumen in not only identifying opportunities for monetizing products but also providing significantly improved user experiences. 
 
Passionate about innovating, developed ideas and algorithms that have made an impact on hundreds of millions of web users.  
 
Like working with smart people and have strong work ethics.

Search) Yahoo Search March 2013  –  March 2014  (1 year 1 month) Sunnyvale Tech lead and the first engineer on Yahoo! Search Team that developed and launched the first-of-its-kind Yahoo! Knowledge Graph that powered around 3 million entities on production .  
 
Also, Invented and built the algorithm that powers the "Actors in the movie"​ and "Related Movies and TV shows"​ strip that you see when search on a celebrity entity on Yahoo! Search Page.

As new team members onboarded the effort, i played the role of a mentor and that of an engineering lead expanding and scaling the first version of knowledge graph.  
 
Responsible for design and implementation of  
1) Hbase based data storage ,  
2) internal schemaless search engine to discover data,  
3) scalable grid processing pipelines based on pig/hadoop. 
 
Designed and implemented the Soccer Knowledge Graph that powers the Yahoo! Search FIFA experience in 25 markets (39 languages including double byte languages such as arabic)  
 
Search on 'Cristiano Ronaldo" on Yahoo! Search box on Yahoo.com or search box and you will see the experience that yahoo! offers. This knowledge graph powers the 200x increase in search query volume during FIFA world cup event internationally. 
 
My work is now the seed and crux of a wider effort within the company that revolves around knowledge building from various internal and external sources. Yahoo! Mail (IMAP-Mobile) - Tech Lead Yahoo! September 2009  –  March 2013  (3 years 7 months) Mobile eMail Monetization (IMAP), March 2011 (Yahoo! Inc) 
Engineering Lead for design and development for IMAP content snippets on mobile clients. 
Designed and implemented systems and algorithms for mobile email monetization on IMAP that scale for more than 200 million daily emails. Filed 4 patents.  
Got the Individual You Rock Award. 
 
Nginx based Mail Proxy Servers IMAP/POP Yahoo! Mail, May 2010-Mar 2011 (Yahoo! Inc) 
Rewrote IMAP Gate with NGINX that helped us enable SSL for all clients while reducing hardware cost by over 1 million dollars per year. IMAP is the first end point of the Y! Mail to support SSL, extending IMAP Server capabilities and its performance. As a result it is now open to all Mobile devices, and the servers are handling 2 Billion sessions a day. Got the Team You Rock Award. 
 
AutoProfiling Ymail IMAP Code Base, April 2010 (Yahoo! Inc) 
Designed, developed and integrated ymail_yautoprof, which allows autoprofiling of c++ code using yprof. Can be used by other properties in Yahoo! Extremely efficient, saves developer time, protects against future refactoring of code. 
Created a web interface that allows user to analyze the data. 
 
IMAP for desktop clients, Jan 2010 (Yahoo! Inc)  
 
Implemented LSUB, Subscribe and Unsubscribe for Desktop clients. 
Designed and developed Subscriptions for Desktop clients with an intelligent implementation for maintaining subscription lists in face of client (outlook, thunderbird) behaviors. Senior Software Engineer Yahoo! August 2004  –  March 2013  (8 years 8 months) During 10+ years at Yahoo!, I have worked on several key first-of-its-kind projects that have reached out to 300 million+ internet users and worked with and managed smart people all over the world from Silicon Valley to Bangalore. Check out the different teams/projects i worked on at Yahoo! Yahoo! Integrated Consumer Experiences - Senior Engineer Yahoo! April 2009  –  October 2009  (7 months) Was the lead architect and developer for a number of key components. 
 
Vespa-Content Crawler/Document Processing Chain, April 2009(Yahoo! Inc) 
 
Designed and implemented a perl based mechanism to input a seed list of web urls into the vespa-crawler. Extensive knowledge of crawler internals. Also implemented document processors that add/use attributes.  
 
Feed Source Manager Web Service, Aug 2009(Yahoo! Inc) 
 
Designed and implemented feed source manager web service that fetches data from Coke and Buzz, aggregates them and exposes them to a vespa crawler in a custom xml format. This was implemented using perl processing scripts and php/yapache.  
 
Backend Content Api Web Service, Sept 2009 (Yahoo! Inc) 
Designed and implemented an internal web service that processes content obtained from multiple sources (COKE scoring server) and Vespa index to construct and deliver an atom based feed.. Used phpunit for unit testing. YSM Lead - Internationalization (Search Partner Distribution) Yahoo! August 2008  –  January 2009  (6 months) Launched 18 international versions of Yahoo! client and web server (edit pages,backend server side logic). Used babel, set up distribution flows for partner deals like Adobe, Symantec and CNET. Yahoo! Audience - Architect and Team Lead for Client Backend Infrastructure Yahoo! August 2006  –  2008  (2 years) Designed and implemented staged-migration of more than 100 million toolbars from an existing platform called IDAHO to the new HELIX platform without affecting a live revenue stream of 240 million dollars. Was nominated for Yahoo Superstars for this project. Was responsible for writing server side migration components in c++ and php. 
 
Successfully tuned the performance for the nascent production machines that serviced 200 million active live yahoo! clients. Worked involved optimizing yapache child processes, cou monitoring, apc based caching, setting up ytee environments, profiling of code and optimizing udb reads/writes and managing connections with external properties like mail, messenger and weather platform Yahoo! Audience and Ads, Senior Engineer - Architect for Web Server Back-End Infrastructure Yahoo! September 2005  –  October 2006  (1 year 2 months) Designed and developed a scalable php/yapache-based web platform that serves more than 250 million toolbar clients world wide. Worked on various core components including writing php Arcade accessors for Mail Alert integration, Mesenger Integration.The platform takes 15k hits/second on US colos. Got the You Rock Award for this project. Yahoo! Search - Senior Software Engineer (Search - Firefox Clients) Yahoo! February 2005  –  September 2005  (8 months) Developed the first Firefox Yahoo! Toolbar. Implemented and integrated an innovative Antispy Plugin for the client by my own initiative. Launched on multiple platforms and intls. Read about it here: http://www.ysearchblog.com/2005/04/05/no-platform-left-behind/ Yahoo! Search - Software Development Engineer Yahoo! August 2004  –  September 2005  (1 year 2 months) Developed and worked on IE Toolbar Client and Search Clients, driving 15% of Yahoo! Search Revenue Research Associate Center for Unified Biometrics and Sensors(CUBS) August 2001  –  August 2004  (3 years 1 month) Buffalo/Niagara, New York Area Encryption of Biometric Data 
 
Designed and implemented a technique to encode biometric data by transformations in complex space and hashing based approaches to achieve acceptable verification rates and ensuring the privacy of the user information. The study aims at outline ways to obtain a hash of fingerprint image and still achieve acceptable rates of verification. Currently the rates are 4% Equal Error rate for FVC2002 database for fingerprint verification. Implemented using C++. 
 
Security and Matching of Partial Fingerprint Matching Systems, Security and Defense Symposium, SPIE Conference 04.

Design of optimum 4 state barcode, development of software for Australian, Canadian, UK standards, encoding and decoding information and studying the effect of noise models, for United States Postal Services’ Intelligent Mail Project. The project involved software simulations of encoding and decoding of data, error introduction and correction. Results were compared with similar experiments for other standards including the one proposed by Lockheed Martin. Implemented using C++. Harry’s team are the best in the industry and Harry has a brilliant track record in, motivating, hiring and growing highly technical people.

April 2012  – Present (3 years 5 months) Sunnyvale, CA GeoLocation platform is a scalable infrastructure to determine the location of Yahoo! user accessing any of Yahoo! properties. It maintains a repository of Geoplaces of the world, geocodes an IP to a location and manages locations of users through location management page. Building of various attribute models based on location history of user helps to power content personalization and geo targeted advertisement services. I manage geolocation platform that powers every location-based services of Yahoo! (search, advertisement system, weather, news, front page, etc.).  Engineering Manager, Cloud Platform Group Yahoo! April 2011  –  March 2012  (1 year) Content Platform is a scalable infrastructure on the cloud for ingesting, processing, serving content to all Yahoo! properties (Yahoo! Finance, News, Sports, etc). I am responsible for managing content acquisition system and content ingestion (onto Content Grid) system of the platform.  
 
The volume and variety of data that the content platform acquires and processes ranges from Web Crawl Data (unstructured content) to feeds (structured content) provided by Yahoo!'s partners. The content can range from small data size that it picks up very frequently (every few seconds) to huge data size that it picks up less frequently (once every few hours). Additionally, there are variety of data formats that require to be normalized and almost all industry standard delivery protocols that it supports for enabling this firehose of data. Aggregating the content on-time and making it available on the cloud are absolutely essential to retain freshness of the Yahoo sites. Handling such large data though content acquisition and ingestion system is itself a very complex problem to solve. 
 
Apart from managing the delivery of these complex systems which is very critical for Yahoo!'s success, I was involved in designing these systems with architects of content platforms. Rock-solid design, implementation with quality and ease of operations are among few of the corner stone for delivering such a large scale system that handles terabytes of data on cloud.  Experience Senior Engineering Manager Yahoo! April 2013  – Present (2 years 5 months) Sunnyvale, CA Currently leading contacts/Addressbook engineering team which is part of Xobni/Mail Org to make Yahoo mail more people/entity centric. 
 
- Modernized Adressbook platform (10+ year old codebase) on Apache Traffic Server/Jetty/Redis/NoSQL technology serving 100k+ requests per seconds. 
- Re-implemented cardDAV protocol for contacts to support native mobile sync functionality for key devices like iOS, Android, Kindle Devices. Increased DAU by 4x. 
- Migrated contacts storage from Filer to internal NoSQL datastore format for 400M+ users, added 5TB/region Redis footprint to reduce latency under 10ms.  
- Reduced production release cycle to daily with continuous delivery, new stack helped in reducing production server footprint by 3x with 99.9% availability.  
- Launched Import contacts from Facebook, Outlook, Gmail, CSV sources. Increased daily imported contacts metrics by 2x over multiple quarters by feature iterations. 
- Rolled out multiple features to increase core contacts fields like Name, Photo, Email, Phone numbers.  
- Never miss mail from friends (Rescue inbound mails from spam folder based on address book data of user), Crisis2opportunity (Restore contacts from last 10 backed up snapshots). 
 
Built Credstore platform for Yahoo wide use cases to support partner integration such as Facebook, LinkedIn, Outlook, Twitter etc to securely store and refresh the user’s third party tokens. 
 
I encourage you to try few interesting features of Yahoo mail particularly search for your friend(autosuggest), import contacts from Facebook, sync contacts on iPhone etc where me and my team have put lot of efforts to enhance your experience. Do let me know if you have feedback.

Experience Sr Engineering Manager - Yahoo Mail Yahoo April 2015  – Present (5 months) Sunnyvale, CA Hands-on manager, working on the next major revision of Yahoo Mail, powered by Node.JS and React. Sr Engineering Manager - Yahoo Presentation Technologies Yahoo May 2014  –  March 2015  (11 months) Sunnyvale, CA Managed the Presentation Technologies team, which mission was to work across all organizations and with an industry-wide perspective to bring the best next-generation presentation platforms to Yahoo's web properties. Launched several high profile open source projects, including Pure.CSS (http://purecss.io/) and Format.JS (http://formatjs.io/), as well as multiple internal projects, including a set of extensions for ExpressJS, and a fully automated polyfill delivery service. Engineering Manager Yahoo! Search March 2011  –  May 2014  (3 years 3 months) Sunnyvale, CA Hands-on manager of the search frontend platform team (~8 engineers), which was responsible for migrating the presentation layer of Yahoo's search engine to Node.JS. Changing the engine that powers a $2B/year business is no easy task! But it was a lot of fun, and we learned a lot along the way, including what not to do! Lead Web Developer Yahoo! Search February 2008  –  March 2011  (3 years 2 months) Sunnyvale, CA Led several large scale and strategic projects in web search. Helped define and drive the use of best practices in web development to ensure performance, robustness, and maintainability. Managed the hiring of new talent, training, and mentoring of new hires and junior web developers. Architected and managed the migration of the frontend of Yahoo's search engine from YUI2 to YUI3. Built the YUI3 version of a "search as you type"​ widget internally known as "Search Assist". Web Technologies Evangelist Yahoo! May 2006  –  February 2008  (1 year 10 months) Sunnyvale, CA Worked alongside Douglas Crockford (inventor of the JSON data format, well known author, and conference speaker), Iain Lamb (co-founder of OddPost), and Bill Scott, as part of Yahoo's "Ajax evangelism" team, a group that provided architectural assistance to Yahoo developers on the design and implementation of rich interactions in the browser. 
 
Evangelized best practices in frontend engineering with regard to performance, reliability, security, accessibility, maintainability, and design innovation. My responsibilities included: 
 
* Reviewing architectural designs and analyzing code. 
* Rapidly producing working prototypes. 
* Creating and delivering training materials to frontend engineers. 
 
During that time, I worked closely with the Yahoo Mail and Yahoo Search teams, consulted with many Yahoo properties, and also contributed the YUI Browser History Manager — a library dealing with browser history in single page applications — and the YUI Compressor — a JavaScript and CSS minification tool — to the YUI library. I was also a frequent speaker at numerous (internal and external) conferences and workshops. Senior Software Engineer Scalix January 2004  –  May 2006  (2 years 5 months) San Mateo, CA Worked on the industry's best web-based email and calendaring solution (two-time winner of the LinuxWorld Product Excellence Award, made the cover of InfoWorld magazine, etc.) 
 
Designed and developed the industry's richest web-based calendaring and scheduling software, on par with the level of functionality offered by native applications such as Microsoft Outlook. Among other things, I had to reverse engineer the format of 100+ undocumented binary MAPI properties used internally by Microsoft Outlook and Exchange for calendaring and scheduling. I also developed the entire client logic and user interface, including complex algorithms to deal with: 
 
* Optimal display of overlapping appointments (problem known as bin packing) using a custom designed graph reduction algorithm implemented in JavaScript. 
* Handling of complex recurrence patterns in multiple time zones. 
* Computing and rendering of Free/Busy data. 
 
Designed and developed a set of reusable DHTML user interface widgets (menu, toolbar, tree view, scrollable grid, rich text editor, etc.), a drag-and-drop library, a cross-browser DOM manipulation library, a date manipulation library, etc. 
 
Wrote a set of tools for web developers (including a JavaScript preprocessor and a JavaScript obfuscator) in Java, and streamlined the entire build system (Apache Ant), improving developer productivity. Software Engineer easyplanet March 2001  –  December 2003  (2 years 10 months) Contributed to the design and implementation of the easyplanet Community Desktop™, a social media Windows-based application integrating tabbed browsing with multimedia features, and displaying company brand image and real-time content for the use of large media and entertainment companies.
